These are all medical conditions that are related to the blood and bone marrow. Neutropenia is a condition where there is a decrease in the number of neutrophils (a type of white blood cell) in the blood. Anemia is a condition where there is a decrease in the number of red blood cells or the amount of hemoglobin in the blood. Thrombocytopenia is a condition where there is a decrease in the number of platelets in the blood. Neutropenic fever is a fever that occurs in people with neutropenia, which can be caused by a bacterial infection.
